Description: Ostracon, section (two fragments joined) of the base of a shallow orange-red pottery bowl with foot-ring and slightly flaring sides, both interior and exterior covered with a light-brown slip, remains of eight scrawled lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the interior and remains of five lines of text on the base, both now very worn, containing an account of uncertain nature.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.127)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87640) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87640)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 153 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
